meanings.definition: To undervalue or underestimate the worth of something.
meanings.sent1: She misprized her own talents and never realized how special she truly was.
meanings.sent2: He misprized the importance of education and now regrets not pursuing it.
meanings.sent3: The cat misprized the toy mouse, thinking it was a real threat.
meanings.sent4: The old man misprized the power of technology, but soon found it indispensable.
meanings.sent5: The explorer misprized the map's accuracy and ended up lost in the jungle.

meanings.definition: To hold in low esteem or regard.
meanings.sent1: They misprized the hard work of the volunteers, not realizing their dedication.
meanings.sent2: She misprized her own abilities and never pursued her dreams.
meanings.sent3: The student misprized the teacher's advice, only to regret it later.
meanings.sent4: The company misprized the value of customer feedback, leading to a decline in sales.
meanings.sent5: He misprized the kindness of strangers until he experienced it firsthand.
